President & CEO
Tom Stapley
Tom Stapley is a leader and advocate for manufactured housing. With a career spanning over 17 years in the manufactured housing industry, Tom is committed to building welcoming, safe and well-maintained communities for individuals and families to call home. Tom is an executive founder and the President of Roots Management, which emerged from the merger of Treehouse Communities and Vineyards Communities. Today, Roots is one of the premier companies in the manufactured home industry, operating over 241 communities across 24 states. Tom co-founded Treehouse Group Companies in 2006 and he has been the driving force in helping Treehouse grow and succeed to become a top manufactured housing provider. His leadership is anchored in a commitment to building teams and empowering people. He is dedicated to cultivating opportunities for individuals, families, and entire communities and to creating safe, friendly, and opportunity-rich environments. Tom also co-founded Invitation Homes in 2012, a venture that has grown into the largest single-family rental home company in the United States. With over 80,000 homes in its portfolio, Invitation Homes has reshaped the landscape of single-family rentals. As the President of Roots Management Group, Tom continues to lead with a vision to provide quality housing opportunities for individuals and families.
end widget-span
end row
end row-wrapper
end widget-span
end row
end row-wrapper
CFO
Sarah McCombs Taylor
Sarah McCombs Taylor serves as the Chief Financial Officer of Accounting at Roots Management Group.
Sarah is committed to fostering high-performing teams that deliver exceptional results while building meaningful relationships.
Sarah’s expertise lies in developing practical solutions for complex financial challenges, approaching her work with an open mindset that drives continuous improvement. Before joining Roots, she led the financial reporting department at Spirit Realty Capital, Inc. (NYSE: SRC), a publicly traded Real Estate Investment Trust, where she worked for about eight years. Prior to that, she spent more than seven years at Ernst & Young (EY), a Big 4 public accounting firm, in the Wealth and Asset Management audit practice.
Sarah earned both her Master in Professional Accounting and Bachelor of Business Administration, with a minor in History, from the University of Texas at Austin, where she was part of the prestigious Business Honors Program. She is also a licensed Certified Public Accountant (CPA) in Texas.
end widget-span
end row
end row-wrapper
end widget-span
end row
end row-wrapper
COO
Corey D. Wikstrom
Corey D. Wikstrom is a seasoned executive with a distinguished career in the Manufactured Housing and RV industry.
Corey’s journey in the industry is marked by his exceptional performance in various leadership roles. As former Senior Vice President of Operations at Roots Management Group, at that time the company saw significant improvements in operational efficiency.
Before joining Roots Management Group, Corey was the Chief Operating Officer at Three Pillar Communities. Here he drove the company’s success and was instrumental in the organization’s remarkable growth.
Corey's educational background in Business Administration and Marketing, combined with his extensive experience, makes him an asset to Roots Management Group. His ability to build winning teams, lead operations, and drive growth and efficiency has been consistently demonstrated throughout his career.

CLO
Eric Blum
With nearly 20 years of experience as a corporate attorney with significant experience in real estate, private equity, corporate governance, capital markets and mergers & acquisitions, Eric currently serves as our Chief Legal Officer and Secretary, leading the teams responsible for all legal matters and risk management. He previously served as COO of OZ Impact Funds (the investment arm of Vineyards Management Group) from February 2019 until the merger of OZ and Vineyards into Roots in August 2021, when Eric assumed his current role. He previously worked as an associate at Greenberg Traurig in Las Vegas, Nevada, where his principal practice areas were mergers and acquisitions, securities and corporate finance and corporate governance.
end widget-span
end row
end row-wrapper
end widget-span
end row
end row-wrapper
SVP, Investments
Tim Jurczak
Tim leads the team responsible for acquisitions, dispositions, and development activities in collaboration with the company’s institutional investors. He also plays a key role in cultivating relationships with new capital partners.
Before joining Roots Management Group in August 2021, Tim spent over a decade at Green Courte Partners,
a real estate private equity firm based in Chicago. There, he specialized in acquiring niche real estate assets, with a strong focus on manufactured housing communities nationwide. He was also instrumental in the 2014 sale of Green Courte’s portfolio of 19,000 manufactured housing sites to Sun Communities for approximately $1.3 billion.
Tim holds a degree from the University of Wisconsin-Madison.
Outside of work, he enjoys spending time with family in Rhode Island, reconnecting with friends in Chicago, and playing golf on new courses across the country.
end widget-span
end row
end row-wrapper
end widget-span
end row
end row-wrapper
SVP, Deputy General Counsel
Maria Kenny
Maria oversees corporate governance, regulatory compliance, dispute resolution, and enterprise-wide risk management.
Since joining Roots in 2022, Maria has held a series of progressively senior roles within the company’s legal department. Her previous responsibilities included overseeing insurance and risk management, entity administration and compliance, and providing transactional support.
Before joining Roots, Maria served as in-house counsel at Elo, a global provider of touchscreen technology solutions. Earlier in her career, she was a prosecutor with the Cook County State’s Attorney’s Office in Chicago, Illinois.
end widget-span
end row
end row-wrapper
end widget-span
end row
end row-wrapper
SVP, Operations
Tierria Hilton
As Senior Vice President of the Central Division at Roots Management Group, Tierria Hilton brings nearly 13 years of property management experience, with a strong background in affordable housing and turning distressed properties into profitable assets. Her expertise in strategic problem-solving and operational efficiency has made her a key leader in driving success across the communities she oversees.
Tierria is deeply committed to staff development, ensuring her teams are equipped with the knowledge and skills to manage multimillion-dollar assets effectively. By fostering a culture of growth and excellence, she helps strengthen both individual performance and overall community success.
Before joining Roots, Tierria served as Regional Manager for the Housing Authority in South Carolina, overseeing 29 communities and implementing new operational processes that enhanced efficiency across the organization.
Tierria holds a degree in Business Administration with a concentration in accounting, giving her a strong financial foundation to navigate the complexities of property management. Her passion for enhancing the affordable housing sector continues to shape her impactful leadership.
end widget-span
end row
end row-wrapper
end widget-span
end row
end row-wrapper
SVP, Operations
Tishanna Newman
Tishanna Newman is a dynamic and results-driven leader with over 20 years of experience in the manufactured housing industry. As Senior Vice President for Fund I, II, and IV at Roots Management Group, she oversees community operations, budgeting, home rehabbing, delinquency reduction, and capital improvement projects across her portfolio.
Since joining Roots Management Group four years ago, Tishanna has made a significant impact. She initially managed 18 properties as a Regional Manager before being promoted to Senior Vice President in December 2023. Under her leadership, her team has successfully rehabbed and turned over 900 homes in a year, contributing to a monthly portfolio revenue of approximately $765,000.
With an extensive background in homes, building codes, remodeling, and capital improvements, Tishanna is committed to enhancing community living standards and driving operational efficiency. Her expertise and strategic vision continue to propel Roots Management Group toward growth and success.
end widget-span
end row
end row-wrapper
end widget-span
end row
end row-wrapper
SVP, Data Analytics & IT
Mahesh Salem
Mahesh Salem is the Senior Vice President of Data Analytics and IT at Roots Management Group, bringing over 20 years of top-tier consulting experience in Information Management, Business Intelligence, and Analytics.
With a deep understanding of data-driven solutions, Mahesh has successfully led transformative initiatives across a wide range of industries, including Energy & Utilities, Consumer Packaged Goods, Technology, Telecom & Media, Civil Aviation, Chemicals, and Pharmaceuticals.
Mahesh combines technical expertise with business acumen, specializing in enterprise data strategies, predictive analytics, and AI-driven insights to enhance operational efficiency and accelerate business growth.
end widget-span
end row
end row-wrapper
end widget-span
end row
end row-wrapper
VP, Capital Markets and Risk
Emilio Allen
Emilio Allen leads the Capital Markets and Risk Management functions at Roots. He has over twenty years of mortgage finance experience including closing over $13 billion of multifamily debt transactions. Before joining Roots, Emilio held various roles at Fannie Mae, where he grew multifamily structured transactions, managed technology initiatives for single-family trading desks, and contributed to automated underwriting efforts. He has an MBA from American University with concentrations in real estate & finance and a bachelor's of science from Marquette University in information technology.
end widget-span
end row
end row-wrapper
end widget-span
end row
end row-wrapper
VP, People Operations
Fabiana Larese
Fabiana Larese is a seasoned Human Resources Executive with a strategic and goal-oriented approach to fostering exceptional workplace cultures. With a career spanning diverse industries—including construction, manufacturing, real estate, insurance, and automotive—Fabiana has a proven track record in HR consulting, organizational development, and employee and labor relations.
As Vice President of People Operations at Roots Management Group, Fabiana plays a key role in shaping the company’s HR strategy, ensuring alignment between workforce initiatives and business objectives. She excels in developing compensation and benefits programs, driving talent acquisition and retention strategies, and enhancing company culture to create a thriving work environment.
Passionate about people and performance, Fabiana is dedicated to building strong, engaged teams that contribute to sustainable business growth. Her expertise in HR leadership and corporate strategy makes her an invaluable asset in cultivating a positive and productive workplace at Roots Management Group.
end widget-span
end row
end row-wrapper
end widget-span
end row
end row-wrapper
VP, Portfolio & Asset Management
Max McBride
Max McBride leads the portfolio and asset management functions at Roots Management Group, ensuring the strategic growth and financial performance of the company’s properties. Since joining Roots in 2020, Max has played a key role in analyzing and reporting asset performance across the portfolio. His responsibilities include preparing annual property budgets, assessing financial results, delivering investor reporting, and implementing portfolio strategies to optimize asset value.
Early in his tenure at Roots, Max was instrumental in supporting asset dispositions. Since then, he has led or assisted in the sale or recapitalization of over 6,000 manufactured home sites. His expertise in financial analysis and strategic execution has been integral to the company’s continued success.
Max earned a Bachelor of Science in Finance from Brigham Young University’s Marriott School of Management. Prior to joining Roots, he gained experience in hedge fund administration at Northern Trust, further strengthening his financial and investment management expertise.
end widget-span
end row
end row-wrapper
VP, Dealership & Title
Markita Roberson
With over 20 years of experience in the manufactured housing industry, Markita Roberson leads the Inventory and Licensing team at Roots with a strategic and solutions-driven mindset. She played a pivotal role in implementing efficient inventory processes that support operational scalability and compliance. Known for bringing outside-the-box thinking to complex licensing challenges, Markita and her team have been instrumental in overcoming regulatory roadblocks and streamlining title management. Over the past 2.5 years, Markita’s leadership has driven a significant increase in completed titles and licensing across the Roots portfolio, aiding Roots’ mission to provide best-in-class housing options to its customers.
end widget-span
end row
end row-wrapper
VP, Sales
Daniel Roacho
Daniel Roacho is a seasoned sales executive with over 15 years of experience in the Manufactured Housing industry.
As Vice President of Sales at Roots Management Group, Daniel leads national sales strategy and oversees a high-performing management team responsible for driving occupancy and homeownership across a diverse portfolio. He led the development and launch of the Establish Your Roots (EYR) program—an impactful initiative that helps residents transition from renting to owning, supporting long-term stability and financial empowerment.
Daniel’s career is defined by his ability to build scalable systems, lead with purpose, and deliver results through servant leadership and continuous improvement. He is proud to work alongside a resilient, innovative team that embraces challenges, adapts quickly, and consistently finds new ways to expand access to homeownership.
The son of a construction worker and grandson of a migrant farm laborer, Daniel’s commitment to housing access is deeply personal. He credits his parents for instilling the values of perseverance, humility, and service—principles that continue to guide his leadership. Outside of work, Daniel is a devoted family man and community leader. He is the founder of the DJR Memorial Foundation, a nonprofit dedicated to supporting underserved populations through local resources and community-driven programs. He also founded and coached the Ruachis Baseball Club, a youth baseball program focused on mentorship, discipline, and opportunity through sport.
Daniel holds a Bachelor's degree in Finance from Regis University.
end widget-span
end row
end row-wrapper
VP, Operations Strategy
Tyler Brady
Tyler Brady serves as the Vice President of Operations Strategy at Roots Management Group, where he leads the development and execution of operational strategies that drive efficiency and performance across the organization. His department oversees key areas such as utilities management, market rent optimization, home inventory oversight, delinquency and collections, vendor services, and ancillary revenue opportunities.
Before joining Roots, Tyler spent five years in investment banking at Goldman Sachs, where he gained deep expertise in financial analysis, strategic planning, and operational scalability. He holds an MBA from the University of Utah and brings a data-driven, results-oriented approach to problem-solving and organizational leadership.
An entrepreneur at heart, Tyler is constantly looking for ways to improve existing processes and unlock new opportunities for growth. His global perspective is shaped in part by his experience living in China with his wife, where they embraced new cultures and ideas. Outside of work, Tyler is a dedicated family man who enjoys spending time outdoors and playing sports with his wife and three children.
end widget-span
end row
end row-wrapper
VP, Homes & Capital Expenditures
Duaine Hatch
Duaine Hatch is a seasoned project manager and estimator with over 20 years of experience across disaster restoration, utility infrastructure, and right-of-way acquisition. He has led complex residential and commercial reconstruction efforts, coordinated large-scale utility installations, and secured easements for major transmission and water projects across the U.S.
For the past five years, Duaine has managed capital improvement initiatives for Roots Management Group, overseeing multi-site infrastructure upgrades within mobile home communities. His work includes planning, budgeting, and executing projects that improve community standards, ensure compliance, and boost long-term asset value.
Duaine’s background spans roles at Liberty Restoration, Electrical Consultants Inc., and Utah Disaster Kleenup, where he developed deep expertise in project scoping, cost estimating, and stakeholder coordination. With technical training in architectural, surveying, and civil engineering, along with certifications like Certified Restorer (CR), Duaine brings a hands-on, solutions-driven approach to every project he leads.
end widget-span
end row
end row-wrapper
VP, Marketing & PR
Darrin Caldwell
Darrin Caldwell leads the Marketing, Public Relations, and Business Development Representative (BDR) functions at Roots Management Group. With over 15 years of marketing experience and a passion for fostering progressive change, Darrin has a track record of helping individuals and organizations develop industry-leading skills, systems, and scalable programs.
As VP of Marketing, Darrin oversees a scrappy, high-performing team that has been instrumental in building Roots’ cutting-edge demand generation engine and driving innovation across a broad range of marketing initiatives. He also stewards the full brand experience, ensuring it aligns with Roots’ mission, values, and growth.
Outside of work, Darrin is a devoted husband and father of three who finds inspiration and balance in the great outdoors. Whether fly fishing a quiet stream, scaling rock walls, coaching youth soccer, or backpacking through remote wilderness, he brings the same energy and curiosity to life that he brings to work.
end widget-span
end row
end row-wrapper

President & CEO
Tom Stapley
Tom Stapley is a leader and advocate for manufactured housing. With a career spanning over 17 years in the manufactured housing industry, Tom is committed to building welcoming, safe and well-maintained communities for individuals and families to call home. Tom is an executive founder and the President of Roots Management, which emerged from the merger of Treehouse Communities and Vineyards Communities. Today, Roots is one of the premier companies in the manufactured home industry, operating over 241 communities across 24 states. Tom co-founded Treehouse Group Companies in 2006 and he has been the driving force in helping Treehouse grow and succeed to become a top manufactured housing provider. His leadership is anchored in a commitment to building teams and empowering people. He is dedicated to cultivating opportunities for individuals, families, and entire communities and to creating safe, friendly, and opportunity-rich environments. Tom also co-founded Invitation Homes in 2012, a venture that has grown into the largest single-family rental home company in the United States. With over 80,000 homes in its portfolio, Invitation Homes has reshaped the landscape of single-family rentals. As the President of Roots Management Group, Tom continues to lead with a vision to provide quality housing opportunities for individuals and families.

CFO
Sarah McCombs Taylor
Sarah McCombs Taylor serves as the Chief Financial Officer of Accounting at Roots Management Group.
Sarah is committed to fostering high-performing teams that deliver exceptional results while building meaningful relationships.
Sarah’s expertise lies in developing practical solutions for complex financial challenges, approaching her work with an open mindset that drives continuous improvement. Before joining Roots, she led the financial reporting department at Spirit Realty Capital, Inc. (NYSE: SRC), a publicly traded Real Estate Investment Trust, where she worked for about eight years. Prior to that, she spent more than seven years at Ernst & Young (EY), a Big 4 public accounting firm, in the Wealth and Asset Management audit practice.
Sarah earned both her Master in Professional Accounting and Bachelor of Business Administration, with a minor in History, from the University of Texas at Austin, where she was part of the prestigious Business Honors Program. She is also a licensed Certified Public Accountant (CPA) in Texas.

COO
Corey D. Wikstrom
Corey D. Wikstrom is a seasoned executive with a distinguished career in the Manufactured Housing and RV industry.
Corey’s journey in the industry is marked by his exceptional performance in various leadership roles. As former Senior Vice President of Operations at Roots Management Group, at that time the company saw significant improvements in operational efficiency.
Before joining Roots Management Group, Corey was the Chief Operating Officer at Three Pillar Communities. Here he drove the company’s success and was instrumental in the organization’s remarkable growth.
Corey's educational background in Business Administration and Marketing, combined with his extensive experience, makes him an asset to Roots Management Group. His ability to build winning teams, lead operations, and drive growth and efficiency has been consistently demonstrated throughout his career.

CLO
Eric Blum
With nearly 20 years of experience as a corporate attorney with significant experience in real estate, private equity, corporate governance, capital markets and mergers & acquisitions, Eric currently serves as our Chief Legal Officer and Secretary, leading the teams responsible for all legal matters and risk management. He previously served as COO of OZ Impact Funds (the investment arm of Vineyards Management Group) from February 2019 until the merger of OZ and Vineyards into Roots in August 2021, when Eric assumed his current role. He previously worked as an associate at Greenberg Traurig in Las Vegas, Nevada, where his principal practice areas were mergers and acquisitions, securities and corporate finance and corporate governance.

SVP, Investments
Tim Jurczak
Tim leads the team responsible for acquisitions, dispositions, and development activities in collaboration with the company’s institutional investors. He also plays a key role in cultivating relationships with new capital partners.
Before joining Roots Management Group in August 2021, Tim spent over a decade at Green Courte Partners,
a real estate private equity firm based in Chicago. There, he specialized in acquiring niche real estate assets, with a strong focus on manufactured housing communities nationwide. He was also instrumental in the 2014 sale of Green Courte’s portfolio of 19,000 manufactured housing sites to Sun Communities for approximately $1.3 billion.
Tim holds a degree from the University of Wisconsin-Madison.
Outside of work, he enjoys spending time with family in Rhode Island, reconnecting with friends in Chicago, and playing golf on new courses across the country.

Maria Kenny
Maria oversees corporate governance, regulatory compliance, dispute resolution, and enterprise-wide risk management.
Since joining Roots in 2022, Maria has held a series of progressively senior roles within the company’s legal department. Her previous responsibilities included overseeing insurance and risk management, entity administration and compliance, and providing transactional support.
Before joining Roots, Maria served as in-house counsel at Elo, a global provider of touchscreen technology solutions. Earlier in her career, she was a prosecutor with the Cook County State’s Attorney’s Office in Chicago, Illinois.

SVP, Operations
Tierria Hilton
As Senior Vice President of the Central Division at Roots Management Group, Tierria Hilton brings nearly 13 years of property management experience, with a strong background in affordable housing and turning distressed properties into profitable assets. Her expertise in strategic problem-solving and operational efficiency has made her a key leader in driving success across the communities she oversees.
Tierria is deeply committed to staff development, ensuring her teams are equipped with the knowledge and skills to manage multimillion-dollar assets effectively. By fostering a culture of growth and excellence, she helps strengthen both individual performance and overall community success.
Before joining Roots, Tierria served as Regional Manager for the Housing Authority in South Carolina, overseeing 29 communities and implementing new operational processes that enhanced efficiency across the organization.
Tierria holds a degree in Business Administration with a concentration in accounting, giving her a strong financial foundation to navigate the complexities of property management. Her passion for enhancing the affordable housing sector continues to shape her impactful leadership.

SVP, Operations
Tishanna Newman
Tishanna Newman is a dynamic and results-driven leader with over 20 years of experience in the manufactured housing industry. As Senior Vice President for Fund I, II, and IV at Roots Management Group, she oversees community operations, budgeting, home rehabbing, delinquency reduction, and capital improvement projects across her portfolio.
Since joining Roots Management Group four years ago, Tishanna has made a significant impact. She initially managed 18 properties as a Regional Manager before being promoted to Senior Vice President in December 2023. Under her leadership, her team has successfully rehabbed and turned over 900 homes in a year, contributing to a monthly portfolio revenue of approximately $765,000.
With an extensive background in homes, building codes, remodeling, and capital improvements, Tishanna is committed to enhancing community living standards and driving operational efficiency. Her expertise and strategic vision continue to propel Roots Management Group toward growth and success.

Mahesh Salem
Mahesh Salem is the Senior Vice President of Data Analytics and IT at Roots Management Group, bringing over 20 years of top-tier consulting experience in Information Management, Business Intelligence, and Analytics.
With a deep understanding of data-driven solutions, Mahesh has successfully led transformative initiatives across a wide range of industries, including Energy & Utilities, Consumer Packaged Goods, Technology, Telecom & Media, Civil Aviation, Chemicals, and Pharmaceuticals.

Emilio Allen

Fabiana Larese
Fabiana Larese is a seasoned Human Resources Executive with a strategic and goal-oriented approach to fostering exceptional workplace cultures. With a career spanning diverse industries—including construction, manufacturing, real estate, insurance, and automotive—Fabiana has a proven track record in HR consulting, organizational development, and employee and labor relations.
As Vice President of People Operations at Roots Management Group, Fabiana plays a key role in shaping the company’s HR strategy, ensuring alignment between workforce initiatives and business objectives. She excels in developing compensation and benefits programs, driving talent acquisition and retention strategies, and enhancing company culture to create a thriving work environment.
Passionate about people and performance, Fabiana is dedicated to building strong, engaged teams that contribute to sustainable business growth. VP, Portfolio & Asset Management
Max McBride
Max McBride leads the portfolio and asset management functions at Roots Management Group, ensuring the strategic growth and financial performance of the company’s properties. Since joining Roots in 2020, Max has played a key role in analyzing and reporting asset performance across the portfolio. His responsibilities include preparing annual property budgets, assessing financial results, delivering investor reporting, and implementing portfolio strategies to optimize asset value.
Early in his tenure at Roots, Max was instrumental in supporting asset dispositions. Since then, he has led or assisted in the sale or recapitalization of over 6,000 manufactured home sites. His expertise in financial analysis and strategic execution has been integral to the company’s continued success.
Max earned a Bachelor of Science in Finance from Brigham Young University’s Marriott School of Management. Prior to joining Roots, he gained experience in hedge fund administration at Northern Trust, further strengthening his financial and investment management expertise.

VP, Dealership & Title
Markita Roberson
With over 20 years of experience in the manufactured housing industry, Markita Roberson leads the Inventory and Licensing team at Roots with a strategic and solutions-driven mindset. She played a pivotal role in implementing efficient inventory processes that support operational scalability and compliance. Known for bringing outside-the-box thinking to complex licensing challenges, Markita and her team have been instrumental in overcoming regulatory roadblocks and streamlining title management. Over the past 2.5 years, Markita’s leadership has driven a significant increase in completed titles and licensing across the Roots portfolio, aiding Roots’ mission to provide best-in-class housing options to its customers.

VP, Sales
Daniel Roacho
Daniel Roacho is a seasoned sales executive with over 15 years of experience in the Manufactured Housing industry.
As Vice President of Sales at Roots Management Group, Daniel leads national sales strategy and oversees a high-performing management team responsible for driving occupancy and homeownership across a diverse portfolio. He led the development and launch of the Establish Your Roots (EYR) program—an impactful initiative that helps residents transition from renting to owning, supporting long-term stability and financial empowerment.
Daniel’s career is defined by his ability to build scalable systems, lead with purpose, and deliver results through servant leadership and continuous improvement. He is proud to work alongside a resilient, innovative team that embraces challenges, adapts quickly, and consistently finds new ways to expand access to homeownership.
The son of a construction worker and grandson of a migrant farm laborer, Daniel’s commitment to housing access is deeply personal. He credits his parents for instilling the values of perseverance, humility, and service—principles that continue to guide his leadership. Outside of work, Daniel is a devoted family man and community leader. He is the founder of the DJR Memorial Foundation, a nonprofit dedicated to supporting underserved populations through local resources and community-driven programs. He also founded and coached the Ruachis Baseball Club, a youth baseball program focused on mentorship, discipline, and opportunity through sport.
Daniel holds a Bachelor's degree in Finance from Regis University.

VP, Operations Strategy
Tyler Brady
Tyler Brady serves as the Vice President of Operations Strategy at Roots Management Group, where he leads the development and execution of operational strategies that drive efficiency and performance across the organization. His department oversees key areas such as utilities management, market rent optimization, home inventory oversight, delinquency and collections, vendor services, and ancillary revenue opportunities.
Before joining Roots, Tyler spent five years in investment banking at Goldman Sachs, where he gained deep expertise in financial analysis, strategic planning, and operational scalability. He holds an MBA from the University of Utah and brings a data-driven, results-oriented approach to problem-solving and organizational leadership.
An entrepreneur at heart, Tyler is constantly looking for ways to improve existing processes and unlock new opportunities for growth. His global perspective is shaped in part by his experience living in China with his wife, where they embraced new cultures and ideas. Outside of work, Tyler is a dedicated family man who enjoys spending time outdoors and playing sports with his wife and three children.

VP, Homes & Capital Expenditures
Duaine Hatch
Duaine Hatch is a seasoned project manager and estimator with over 20 years of experience across disaster restoration, utility infrastructure, and right-of-way acquisition. He has led complex residential and commercial reconstruction efforts, coordinated large-scale utility installations, and secured easements for major transmission and water projects across the U.S.
For the past five years, Duaine has managed capital improvement initiatives for Roots Management Group, overseeing multi-site infrastructure upgrades within mobile home communities. His work includes planning, budgeting, and executing projects that improve community standards, ensure compliance, and boost long-term asset value.
Duaine’s background spans roles at Liberty Restoration, Electrical Consultants Inc., and Utah Disaster Kleenup, where he developed deep expertise in project scoping, cost estimating, and stakeholder coordination. With technical training in architectural, surveying, and civil engineering, along with certifications like Certified Restorer (CR), Duaine brings a hands-on, solutions-driven approach to every project he leads.

Darrin Caldwell

As VP of Marketing, Darrin oversees a scrappy, high-performing team that has been instrumental in building Roots’ cutting-edge demand generation engine and driving innovation across a broad range of marketing initiatives.
